storyInfo: Sami's plants enrich the Rhine Tech Eco-Garden's collection, and also bring the answer that Muelsyse has been searching for all this time.

attributes.content: How goes it, Kelly?
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher A

attributes.content: Just finished logging the Polar Area's plant monitoring data. Most of our fifty-three newcomer plants show no abnormal traits, and have survived the initial observation period. But as you can see here...
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher B

attributes.content: This Sheath Zelkova by the door? These two severely curled up leaves are a sign of dehydration.
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher A

attributes.content: That patch of Icefield Cottongrass is clearly still growing, but the number of cotton balls hasn't been increasing much, and the amount of cotton fiber is lower than normal too.
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher A

attributes.content: That Square Sunflower is our most obvious case. Its disc florets should be always extending towards the sun, but it's drooping so low it's almost touching the soil.
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher B

attributes.content: All within expectations. We've only just begun planning out the vivarium's Polar Area, so we're lacking both data for integration and accumulated experience.
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher A

attributes.content: Quick, go ask Director Muelsyse about it. She'll definitely know where the problems lie.
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher A

attributes.content: (Speaking of which, there's something magical about the way the Director knows plants so well. Everyone's been secretly wondering if she really can talk to plants.)
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher B

attributes.content: (Don't go spouting nonsense now.)
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher A

attributes.content: Kelly, try resetting the parameters of this area's circulation system, and add some mycorrhiza bacteria to the substrate to promote the absorption of water and nutrients.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Director Muelsyse!
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researchers A & B

attributes.content: ...But the parameters were precisely configured according to the data sent by Miss Magallan.
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher B

attributes.content: It's true that Maggy sent the plants, but she's just an explorer. What does she know about botany?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Every bit of biological data she collected is only true for when these plants are growing in Sami.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: The vivarium is still too 'warm' for them.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Try lowering the temperature and humidity a little.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Alright, Director.
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher B

attributes.content: Next up is inspecting the Plateau Zone, right? Let's head there together.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: (Moving fingers contentedly)
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: (Vigorously stretching)
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: Be careful, Sheath Zelkova. Your fingers have been curled up all this time, so take care to not strain your veins when stretching them out so suddenly.
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: Hey, don't get me started. Quit moving around so much, your cotton's flying all over my face.
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: What did that guy say earlier? The plateau area is just a little further up? Maybe we can talk to the legendary Stipa if I send my cotton flying a bit further.
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: You only just left Sami, so everything feels new to you, huh.
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: Hey, Square Sunflower. Why so quiet?
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: He's wilting. Where's his energy gone? I guess he's still not used to the new environment yet.
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: No, I haven't seen him eating or drinking at all, so my guess is that he's feeling a little moody.
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: So they do have emotions.
Who said that?
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: ...It's raining.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: It can rain indoors? Or is this that so-called circulation system?
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: What sort of rain is this? Why are the droplets sticking to my branches? I can't shake them off.
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: Hiya, fellas. Let's reacquaint ourselves, shall we? I'm Muelsyse.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You're here again.
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: Whoopsie daisy. I went to find Nasti to modify some equipment. She's not exactly the chatty type, so it took some time.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Anyhow, you guys are looking way peppier than before.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: We make do.
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: At least you haven't been curling up your leaves on purpose, right?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: I'm gonna be personally overseeing the Polar Area until the second batch of plants arrives next month, okay?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: So I'll be switching up your substrate at noon. I redid the new formula according to the soil samples I got from Sami.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You'll get all the yummy nutrients you need through the 'rain' or 'dew' at random. We're scrapping the 'regular' pattern.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Lemme know if you need anything else. Terrain, air, soil, water, climate... what are the optimal conditions for you to survive? Don't be shy now, me and the vivarium don't judge.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You're so patient with us, Muelsyse.
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: I actually included a Polar Area when I first planned this place out, but no one from Ecological had been to Sami back then. So we shelved it.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But I've been directing ecological experiments at Rhine for the past few years, so I thought we had a solid enough foundation to...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Why Sami?
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: Many see it as an inaccessible and frigid region. Sealed off, isolated, mysterious, dangerous.
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: Well, it's not just Sami I'm interested in. I've got my peepers on every special ecosystem in Terra.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Sami's just specialer than most. Wetlands, forests, and icefield, in that order. A weird combo, really... Hmm, how do I put it? A little 'forced'?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Plus, while it is absolutely freezing compared to the centrum, it's got abnormally abundant biodiversity that doesn't conform to the laws of ecology at all.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: So my best guess is that Sami's just really 'clean.'
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: 'Clean'?
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: I took some physiological samples from you guys... The amount of Originium granules in your root systems is way lower than average.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Could you try dumbing that down for a plant?
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: Sami is by far the best environment for my experiments.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: So, you want to recreate a 'Sami' in this giant glass house?
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: A glass house... uh-huh.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But why, Muelsyse?
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: Because I'm the youngest and bestest ecologist here at Rhine Lab, of course!
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: I've got both the ability and the responsibility to turn this glass house here into the cleanest place in Terra. It'll have the freshest air, the most hospitable climate, and the most nutritious soil.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: It'll have the richest ecosystem ever, for every kind of fragile lifeform to freely thrive in.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: That's what I've always been... um, pursuing?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: (Forcefully shedding cotton)
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: (Shaking branches and leaves freely)
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: Hehe, thankies.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Is that something worth applauding?
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Square Sunflower! You scared the spit outta me, suddenly opening your mouth like that!
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: He's been like that ever since he arrived, more than half a month ago.
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: What a downer. He's always sulking about something.
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: He's still brooding over how he got transplanted from the forests of Sami to a strange city.
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: But what's done is done, so why not just get used to it here? One of my cotton balls floated into the water of the compartment next door, and I could taste the 'seawater's saltiness.'
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: Who knows? If you'd stayed in Sami you might be manure by now. The seeds of your special disc florets make you both fowlbeast fodder and a digestive aid for carnivores with big appetites.
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: You should spit out your cotton properly before spouting all that nonsense.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Icefield Cottongrass

attributes.content: Muelsyse. Don't you want to know why I've been wilting since I got here? Aren't you curious?
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: A Square Sunflower's disc florets will always face the sun. True, your vivarium's lighting system can even simulate how the sunlight changes at different times of day.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: It's very... what you people would call, 'advanced.'
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: ...But in the end, it's no sun.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: The real sun is outside your glass house. But remove this layer of glass, and this mix of soil, air, temperature, moisture, and microbial clusters will no longer be tenable.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Even if you perfectly replicated each and every grain of soil, gust of cold wind, and block of ice from Sami, this place would still be no different from the specimen box you put me in to bring me here.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Well... compared to most other plants, the way you photosynthesize is kinda special, so there's not much I can do about that.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: That's not what I meant.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: No, I gotcha.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Oceans, mudflats, forests, deserts, the Black Flow... Wherever you lift the veil of nature, you're bound to find a nice surprise.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Whether a place has four distinct seasons, is warm and pleasant all year round, has harsh extremes that flip from bitterly cold to scorching hot, or whatever else, it's just the result of natural evolution over thousands of years.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: ...And not a perfectly set up 'experimental environment.'
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: This place will never become 'Sami.'
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Sheesh. Do you know how much I wish I could grab you fellas and show you around Rhine HQ and Trimounts?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Sure, Sami is a mystery to me. But science is just as much a mystery to you guys.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Science can help us break the boundaries of nature. Shape new environments. It can help us... find answers.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You're lying to yourself, Muelsyse.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: A tech company's exploration platform has discovered the last surviving grove of Pale Conifers in the mountainous region of northern Columbia...
And what's that got to do with you?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: There's a mountain village nearby, and though the population registry has been outdated for ages... some of the names in it match up with a missing persons list from Trenton.
Pretty sure not even Director Jara would be this concerned with what her employees get up to after hours.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Your behavior is far, far from gentlemanly, Justin Jr.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Hey now, don't get offended. I don't have any ulterior motives, and besides, I don't even know what you've been trying to track down.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I just happened to catch a glance at this while negotiating a business deal, and figured a certain Director Muelsyse might agree to a date if she were interested.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Wait, is our well-connected Director of Business actually a coward? They don't keep me that busy over at Ecological, you know.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: I'll come find you. Are you over at HQ?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: At the café downstairs. I seem to recall you complaining about the decor in my office and refusing to enter.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I'll catch you at your office this time around then.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You're back. Has it already been more than half a month since you left so suddenly?
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Icefield Cottongrass, she's...
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: I saw.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: It is raining inside the vivarium.
Raindrops seep into the veins of the Zelkova leaves, drench the Square Sunflower's disc florets, and fall onto the stem of the withered plant next to them.
The rain is neither heavy nor fast, but seems to have no intention of stopping.
Muelsyse, are you crying?
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: I don't blame you.
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: That researcher, Kelly? She tried her best too...
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Be it adding more nutrient solutions or replacing the substrate, they just can't compare to Sami's natural sustainability systems. But the Polar Area biome still isn't ready...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Hey, stop crying. You're drenching us in your tears and its killing me.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Maybe... Maybe I should delay the next batch of plants from Sami coming in next month.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Hmm. Are you the type to be so easily shaken?
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Well... exploring new scientific frontiers was never gonna be easy, and a setback or two was expected...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: So why are you crying?
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: I made a trip to the mountains in northern Columbia, after my little chat with Justin Jr.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Was it far?
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Not really. Took me three or four days... I just ended up staying there for a whole week.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: If it wasn't far, why did you only make the trip now?
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Because just finding the place took forever.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: From the orphanage in Trenton, to the deserted old houses, to the university in Trimounts, and to the laboratories of Rhine Lab...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: From the voluminous records in the library, to the nameless inscriptions, to experiment records with hardly any headway—yes, I even conducted experiments using samples taken from myself...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: I spent a long, long time searching for it.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: And then finally I found it. Where I thought I'd find the answers about my parents, my people, and myself.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: I have to turn this glass house into the cleanest place in Terra. It must have the freshest air, the most hospitable climate, and the most nutritious soil...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: It must have the richest ecosystem ever, for every kind of fragile life to freely thrive in.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: ...Including me.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: And that's why I need those answers. I have to know why my life is so frail, why I'm so sensitive to Originium Zones.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: I need to know what I am, what 'Elves' are. I need to know how I was born, if my kin still reside on this land, and where... my future lies.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: ...And you came back without an answer.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: There was only a dilapidated mountain village, a patch of dying trees, and a simple and crude cemetery... Time has buried it all.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: There's no way to even tell if those Elves buried in the Pale Conifers had the answers I've been looking for, or if they were looking for them just as hopelessly as me.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Muelsyse, are you alright?
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: You look exhausted. Here, you can lean on my trunk.
attributes.name: Sheath Zelkova

attributes.content: You were right, Sunflower.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: The vivarium's snowy mountains aren't actually mountains, and the icefield isn't an icefield. I'll never be able to recreate a 'Sami,' ever.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Because how can I, when I myself don't even know what kind of land I'm looking for?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: The rainfall continues.
Rootless waterdrops form a pitter patter curtain of rain in the vivarium.
Stop crying.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: It never rains like this in Sami. If you cry any more, you're going to destroy the Polar Area's ecology. And then the other plants will get sick, and you'll worry even more.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: You know...
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: The life cycle of Icefield Cottongrass really isn't long at all. When the winter wind on the icefield is at its strongest, not even a single cotton clump can hold onto its branches.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Two days ago the Polar Area was practically smothered in white cotton wool. For a moment I really thought I was back on the Sami icefield.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: It's Cottongrass's fault anyway, for being too curious. She was sending her clumps everywhere while you were away the past few days. They were all over the Polar Area, the Plateau Area, and the Ocean Area. She probably got her wish.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: She counted up all the plants in the entire vivarium... there's nearly a thousand species in here, and many of them should already be extinct from various ecological disasters.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: You said you wanted to build an ideal habitat here, but what you're actually doing is much more than that... Erm, when I put it that way, you're pretty similar to those other guys.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: I'm saying I've met people like you.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Actually, I realized it from the start. I just wasn't completely sure... All of you can 'feel' us. You're all doing something similar, except you're doing it in a lab while they're in a forest.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Plants are their bandages, while the rain and dew serve as their painkillers... I think they were mending Sami's wounds.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: Are you sure, Sunflower?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Of course, I even helped them out.
attributes.name: Square Sunflower

attributes.content: The rain stops.
Muelsyse stands in the center of the vivarium, pensively gazing at the plants in front of her.
I conducted two comparative experiments and the results were consistent. Basically, my deductions from dissecting and screening your samples were right.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: To date, the chemical composition of the seeds in your disc florets are unknown to academia, and they've proven to be decisive evidence for my conclusions.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You really are a super duper special plant. You have some kinda 'healing' property, we just don't know what exactly in nature you're meant to be healing.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But plants don't do that on their own.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: In other words, someone's putting you to use. And those someones are also a part of Sami's natural sustainability systems.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Hey, Sami? Any of my people up there?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Sunlight penetrates the glass, and the Square Sunflower's drooping disc florets move ever so slightly.
Thank you, my imaginary friends.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Director Muelsyse...
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Uh, your... I'm so sorry for your loss!
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher

attributes.content: Umm...?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You can talk to plants, right? The Icefield Cottongrass... I...
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher

attributes.content: Kelly! That's crazier than the rumors I hear about the old goat turning himself into a super cyborg to have late night boxing matches with Saria!
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: ...I-I apologize.
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher

attributes.content: Ah, right. I came to hand you this letter.
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher

attributes.content: They're invitations from the leading scientific journals. You know, 'The TIT Academic Journal', 'Biology Review', and 'Nature Communications.' They're all really interested in your recent research results.
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher

attributes.content: Your plant information experiments have proven workable in the fields of both plant physiology and plant phylogenetics. This marks a major breakthrough in ecology.
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher

attributes.content: Hey now, I don't deserve all the credit. You guys helped too!
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: So what should we do with the invitations?
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher

attributes.content: We'll take their offers, but could you write back to the editors for me? The submissions might come a teensy bit late.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Are you taking some time off? You did just throw yourself back into your work right after that long trip.
attributes.name: Ecological Section Researcher

attributes.content: Nope. I'm taking a little trip to Sami.
attributes.name: Muelsyse
